SRP.Q: On Young Adults, what is the spatial relationship of the data point in 1989 relative to that in 1987 in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: On Young Adults, the data point in 1989 is {below} and to the {right} of the data point in 1987.

SRP.Q: In 1978, what is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the line representing Rural Communities relative to Young Adults?
SRP.A: In 1978, Rural Communities is {above} Young Adults in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: What is the trend of Rural Communities's Technology Adoption Rate levels?
VPR.A: Rural Communities's technology adoption rate levels show a {bimodal peak} trend.

VPR.Q: What is the trend of Young Adults's Technology Adoption Rate levels?
VPR.A: Young Adults's technology adoption rate levels show a {exponential falling} trend.

NC.Q: Between 1981 and 1984, which line experienced a larger change in Technology Adoption Rate, Young Adults or Rural Communities?
NC.A: {Young Adults} experienced a larger change in technology adoption rate.

NC.Q: Was Rural Communities's Technology Adoption Rate in 1976 higher or lower than in 1985?
NC.A: The technology adoption rate in 1976 was {lower} than in 1985.

NC.Q: Between 1976 and 1988, which line experienced a larger change in Technology Adoption Rate, Young Adults or Rural Communities?
NC.A: {Young Adults} experienced a larger change in technology adoption rate.

NC.A: In 1979, {Rural Communities} had a higher technology adoption rate.

VA.Q: Perform the Douglas-Peucker algorithm to simplify the line representing the Young Adults. List the x-coordinates of data points to be preserved.(3 points need to be provided)
VA.A: The x-coordinates of the data points to be preserved are: {1976, 1982, 1989}.
